entries.title: What has Trump done as president so far? The Wall Street Journal is tracking his biggest moves to reshape the federal government. See the full list.
Trump allies sold sponsorships to what appeared to be a Treasury event. It wasn’t.
Funding for federal agencies lapsed beginning at 12:01 a.m. on Wednesday, after Congress was unable to pass a stopgap bill to prevent a government shutdown
The relationship between capitalism and democracy in America isn’t always easy. But history shows that when the two clash, it can strengthen both.
What to know about the Gaza deal between Israel and Hamas
The Trump administration is moving to keep some staffers at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention after telling them Friday that they were laid off
Federal workers are already starting to miss pay, and some businesses that count on a fully functioning federal government say layoffs and costly delays will accelerate
As the government shutdown drags on with no end in sight, references to the movie “Groundhog Day” abound at the Capitol
Budget chief Russell Vought had vowed to fire federal workers if Democrats refused to vote to reopen the government. On Friday, he did so.
Trump said funds have been identified to pay military servicemembers next week, with the government shutdown expected to continue and Congress still at an impasse
Recent moves by President Trump reflect a commander in chief who feels as though he has faced surprisingly little resistance to his ambitious agenda in his second term
Democrats were expecting to comfortably wrestle back control in Virginia next month. Instead, the local party has been thrown into crisis
Curtis Sliwa has six cats, wears a red beret and is running to be the next mayor of New York City. Many wish he wouldn’t.
President Trump said films made outside the U.S. would face a 100% tariff, repeating his threat made earlier this year against the movie industry
In “107 Days,” former Vice President Kamala Harris laments not separating herself from Joe Biden during her short 2024 bid for the presidency
Republican Brad Raffensperger, the election chief who drew Donald Trump’s ire for refusing to overturn Georgia’s 2020 election results, is planning to run for governor, according to his campaign
Qatar Facility at U.S. Air Force Base in Idaho Sparks Controversy
The Senate rejected a measure that would have required President Trump to seek congressional approval before authorizing further U.S. military action in the Caribbean
Here’s what to know about President Trump’s deployment of the National Guard on U.S. soil
Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s emphasis on physical prowess comes as experts say future wars will depend more on cutting-edge technology, precision strikes and AI
Trump ordered another lethal military strike on an alleged drug-trafficking boat in the Caribbean, signaling the administration is undeterred by mounting legal questions about the campaign
